publications.name: Longitudinal monitoring of the mouse brain reveals heterogenous network trajectories during aging
publications.summary: A longitudinal rs-fMRI study in mice revealed sex-dependent trajectories of brain network reorganization during aging, showing patterns of de-differentiation in females and increased somatomotor connectivity in males.

publications.name: The effects of sexual abuse on female adolescent brain structures
publications.publisher: Scandinavian Journal of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry and Psychology
publications.summary: This study found that sexually abused adolescent females had structural brain changes in the amygdala, hippocampus, and prefrontal cortex, suggesting neurobiological alterations even in the absence of psychiatric diagnoses.

publications.name: Learning-related contraction of gray matter in rodent sensorimotor cortex is associated with adaptive myelination
publications.summary: Longitudinal VBM and immunohistochemistry in mice demonstrated that learning induces dynamic intracortical myelination, correlating with nonlinear changes in gray and white matter volumes.

publications.name: The Aged Striatum: Evidence of Molecular and Structural Changes Using a Longitudinal Multimodal Approach in Mice
publications.summary: Using PET and MRI, this study showed that aging mice exhibit decreased striatal D2 receptor availability and increased gray matter density, reflecting similar patterns seen in human aging.

publications.name: A longitudinal study of lateral ventricle volumes in deficit and non-deficit schizophrenia
publications.summary: Over a five-year period, lateral ventricles expanded more in deficit than in non-deficit schizophrenia patients, suggesting differing trajectories of structural brain change.

publications.name: Brain areas associated with resilience to depression in high-risk young women
publications.summary: Young women resilient to depression showed increased volume and thickness in salience and limbic network regions, highlighting potential neural correlates of resilience.

publications.name: Testing an Internet-Based Turkish Obesity Behavioral Therapy Program: A Randomized Study
publications.summary: A web-based cognitive behavioral therapy program led to significantly greater short-term weight loss compared to email education among Turkish overweight individuals.

publications.name: The negative association between amygdala volume and harm avoidance trait in healthy young women with a history of familial depression
publications.summary: In healthy women with familial depression, smaller amygdala volume correlated with higher harm avoidance, suggesting a neuroanatomical link to personality traits.

publications.name: Investigating Connectivity of Orbitomedial Prefrontal Region in a Patient with Traumatic Brain Injury
publications.summary: A case study using DTI tractography revealed disrupted white matter connectivity in the orbitomedial prefrontal cortex following traumatic brain injury, highlighting the role of white matter damage in post-TBI symptoms.

publications.name: Cortical thickness and VBM in young women at risk for familial depression and their depressed mothers with positive family history
publications.summary: Both high-risk daughters and their depressed mothers showed similar structural differences in temporoparietal and prefrontal regions, supporting these as potential trait markers for depression.

publications.name: The relationship between the anterior corpus callosum size and prefrontal cortex volume in drug-free depressed patients
publications.summary: The study found that depressed patients have reduced prefrontal cortex volume and a disrupted correlation with anterior corpus callosum size, indicating impaired structural connectivity.

publications.name: Reduced left uncinate fasciculus fractional anisotropy in deficit schizophrenia but not in non-deficit schizophrenia
publications.summary: DTI analysis showed that deficit schizophrenia patients had lower fractional anisotropy in the left uncinate fasciculus, suggesting specific frontotemporal white matter alterations.

publications.name: Small frontal gray matter volume in first-episode depression patients
publications.summary: First-episode, drug-naive depressed patients exhibited reduced frontal gray matter volume, supporting the presence of neurostructural changes early in the course of depression.
